text: A recurrent neural network (RNN) is a special type of computer program that can remember things it has seen before. RNNs do this by connecting information from the past (called a hidden state) with new information. Because of this, RNNs are good at processing data in a sequence, like understanding language, translating between languages, or predicting what might come next in a sequence. == References == Category:Machine learning
title: Recurrent neural network
